basic_info.official_name: THE GOVERNMENT OF BRUNEI DARUSSALAM SCHOLARSHIP FOR FOREIGN STUDENTS TENABLE IN BRUNEI DARUSSALAM (BDGS) ACADEMIC SESSION 2025/2026
basic_info.provider: Government of Brunei Darussalam, Ministry of Foreign Affairs

funding_info.funding_details: The scholarship is generally described as fully funded. However, specific details indicate that out of 105 awards, 30 scholarships cover full tuition fees while 75 cover 50% of tuition fees.
covered_expenses: economy class air-ticket to and from Brunei Darussalam

timeline_info.opening_date: Applications are now open for the 2025/2026 academic session

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students/foreign students. Applicants must intend to pursue Diploma, Undergraduate, or Postgraduate Master’s Degree programs at Universiti Brunei Darussalam (UBD), Universiti Islam Sultan Sharif Ali (UNISSA), Universiti Teknologi Brunei (UTB), and Politeknik Brunei (PB).

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Various disciplines including Arts, Sciences, Engineering, Islamic Studies, Business, and Humanities.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Applicants should pursue a field of study relevant to Brunei Darussalam's interests.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Diploma, Undergraduate, or Postgraduate Master’s Degree. Applicants for undergraduate/diploma must have completed 12 years of education. Minimum qualification of Five (5) Distinctions (As & Bs) in the Senior (for some levels).

experience_requirements.min_years: 2 years post qualification or employment practice (specifically mentioned for applicants from Nigeria)
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work experience, post qualification or employment practice

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proficiency in English with a Credit 6 at GCE 'O' Level Examination or a Grade 'C' in IGCSE English (as a second language) or an IELTS score of 6.0.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Required. Assessment on the applicant’s academic ability.
additional_requirements.career_plan: Required. An essay of up to 200 words describing the plan of study/research and relating it to future career plans.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Not to exceed 35 years for Master/Postgraduate programmes. General age limit is 35 years.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Scholarship recipients are not permitted to undertake any paid employment or serve on the staff of any country's representative mission in Brunei Darussalam during the scholarship duration. Upon completion, recipients must leave Brunei Darussalam immediately and return to their country of origin.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants interested in Universiti Brunei Darussalam (UBD) must also complete an online application through UBD's admission portal. All applicants from Nigeria must have completed N.Y.S.C.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online Application Form (BDGS Application Form), Reference Letter, Essay/Personal Statement.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Successful candidates will be notified in late 2025.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Government of Brunei Darussalam Scholarship (BDGS) is an annual award scheme for foreign students to pursue Diploma, Undergraduate, and Postgraduate Master’s Degree programs at higher education institutions in Brunei Darussalam for the 2025/2026 academic session.

basic_info.official_name: Danish Government Scholarship at University of Southern Denmark (SDU)
basic_info.provider: Danish Government through the Ministry of Higher Education and Science

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship providing comprehensive financial support. Covers full tuition fees and provides a monthly stipend for living expenses.

timeline_info.application_deadline: February intake: October 15, 2025; September intake: March 1, 2026. Other deadlines mentioned include February 1, 2025 (for Sept 2025-26 intake), September 1, 2025, and January 8, 2026.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students from non-EU/EEA countries (and outside Switzerland for some programs). Applicants must be highly qualified/high-achieving and must be accepted into an eligible Master's program at SDU, specifically in engineering programs at the Vejle or Sønderborg campus. Must complete and submit the online admission application for the chosen Master's program at SDU.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master's degree programs, specifically engineering Master's programs, at the University of Southern Denmark (SDU). Programs are offered at the Vejle and/or Sønderborg campuses.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Scholarship is only for Master's studies. The official SDU website states scholarships can only be awarded for programs offered on the Vejle campus, though other sources mention Sønderborg campus programs.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA of 8.2 on the Danish 7-point grading scale (or 9 on an unspecified scale) or a minimum GPA of 2.0. Applicants are ranked according to grade point average.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate degree from a nation other than Switzerland and the EU/EEA.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: TOEFL score of 575 (paper-based), 230 (computer-based), or 88 (internet-based). English proficiency comparable to Danish B level. One source states 'no IELTS needed'.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Motivation letter required. Must complete scholarship application form via university portal. Non-EU/EEA nationality. Excellent academic background.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Online admission application for chosen Master's program via SDU portal (a separate application for the scholarship is not needed). Completed scholarship application form (if applicable, via university portal). Motivation letter. Reference letters.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applicants are ranked according to grade point average. Scholarship awarded to highly qualified/high-achieving applicants.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Exceptional opportunity to study in Denmark for free, acknowledging the important impact of non-EU/EEA students. It's a transformative chance to pursue postgraduate education in a leading research environment at SDU (one of the world's top 50 universities). Helps talented students cover tuition and living expenses while experiencing Denmark’s academic and multicultural environment. Students at public universities in Denmark may get 3 years of post-study work (PSW) to work and settle in Denmark.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarship for the 2026 academic year, with some mentions of 2025-2026 and 2026-2027.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarships for international students. The scholarship offers full financial support and will cover all expenses for the duration of the study.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to international students from ASEAN or Non-ASEAN countries (all around the world). Applicants must wish to pursue graduate studies (Master's or PhD) at Chulalongkorn University. Students who have been studying in any program at Chulalongkorn University for more than one semester are not eligible to apply for this scholarship.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master’s and PhD degree programs in a wide range of academic fields, including Information Studies, International Business Management (MM).

academic_requirements.required_degree: For Master's program: Completed Bachelor's degree. For PhD program: Completed both Bachelor's and Master's degrees.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Good command of English with the minimum English score that meets the requirement of the respective program. Demonstrated by a certificate of English proficiency from the applicant’s prior university or by results on standardised tests like the TOEFL (minimum 500) or IELTS (minimum 5.0).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two Recommendation Letters (for Master's and Ph.D. applicants)
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Students from ASEAN or Non-ASEAN countries, who have been studying in any program at Chulalongkorn University for more than one semester, are not eligible to apply for this scholarship.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Valid Passport Copy, Medical Certificate (confirming good health), In good health to attend a degree program.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Valid Passport Copy, Medical Certificate (confirming good health), Two Recommendation Letters (for Master's and Ph.D. applicants), Scholarship Request form, Proposal & Schedule of Plan, Accepted Letter from Host University (if applicable). All application documents must be completed and merged into one PDF file.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Qualified applicants are selected by the scholarship program committee for foreign countries.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Chulalongkorn University, Thailand’s oldest and most prestigious university, offers fully funded graduate scholarships (Master’s and PhD) for international students from ASEAN and Non-ASEAN countries. The university established the “Graduate scholarship programme for ASEAN or Non-ASEAN countries” to provide financial assistance. The university was officially established by King Vajiravudh on 26 March 1917 and named after his father King Chulalongkorn.

covered_expenses: Monthly stipend (up to 9000 TL per month)

timeline_info.application_deadline: February 20th (for the respective application year, e.g., February 20, 2025 for 2025 applications, February 20, 2026 for 2026 applications)
timeline_info.opening_date: January 10th (for the respective application year, e.g., January 10, 2025 for 2025 applications, January 10, 2026 for 2026 applications)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must fulfill specific requirements which vary by study level and scholarship category. Generally awarded to outstanding students. Short-term scholarship programs may have additional requirements.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: All fields of studies, including engineering, social sciences, health sciences, basic sciences, humanities, natural sciences, performing arts, music, fine arts, medicine, architecture, law, guidance and psychological counseling, international relations, field studies, Islamic theology, journalism, landscape design, languages, linguistics, manufacturing engineering and technology, arts, culture, and sports.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 70% for undergraduate programs; 75% for master's and PhD programs. Higher GPA is key for competitive majors.
academic_requirements.required_degree: Associate, Undergraduate, Master's, PhD, and Research levels.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Research projects, internships, work experiences, publications, presentations.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Language proficiency is required; specific tests like TOEFL IBT (e.g., 75 for some programs) may be needed. All recipients take a one-year Turkish language course.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: At least one letter of recommendation is required.
additional_requirements.career_plan: Personal statement/Letter of Intent is a crucial component, which typically includes career plans/goals.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Under 21 for undergraduate programs; Under 30 for master's programs; Under 35 for PhD programs; Under 50 for Research Scholarships.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: CNIC/Passport, Letter of Recommendation, Personal Statement, academic credentials, resume/CV (including research projects, internships, work experiences, publications, presentations).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Interviews are usually held at Turkish embassies or consulates in the applicant’s home country.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Government-funded, competitive, and comprehensive program for outstanding international students to pursue full-time or short-term programs at prestigious Turkish universities. It aims to strengthen educational and cultural ties. It is the largest Turkish scholarship program for international students, receiving over 250,000 applications for the 2024/2025 cycle.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Applications typically open on January 10th and close on February 20th each year for the subsequent academic year (e.g., 2025 applications for 2025-2026 academic year).

basic_info.provider: Hungarian Government (managed by Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade, coordinated by Tempus Public Foundation)

funding_info.funding_details: Tuition-free education. Monthly stipend: HUF 43,700 (~EUR 103) for general levels, HUF 140,000 (cca EUR 365) for the first 4 semesters of doctoral level, and HUF 180,000 (cca EUR 470) for the second 4 semesters of doctoral level (paid for 12 months a year). Accommodation contribution: Free dormitory place OR a contribution of HUF 40,000/month. Medical insurance: up to HUF 65,000 (~EUR 160) annually. The scholarship is meant to cover living expenses for one person only, with no financing or visa exemption for accompanying family members. Scholarship holders may need to add their own financial resources to cover all living expenses.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to foreign students from almost 80 countries. Applicants must be certified full-time students and apply through their country's Sending Partner. Eligibility for specific scholarship types and study fields is determined by educational cooperation programmes between Hungary and the specific Sending Partner country. The Students at Risk Subprogramme is also available.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Bachelor’s, Master’s, One-tier Master’s, Non-degree programmes (including Hungarian language preparatory programmes), Postgraduate specialist training courses, PhD programmes, and Partial (exchange) study programmes.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Applicants are eligible only for scholarship types and study fields determined in the educational cooperation programmes between Hungary and their specific Sending Partner. Scientific fields, education levels, and number of applicants vary by country.

academic_requirements.required_degree: For Bachelor's/One-tier Master's/Non-degree Hungarian language preparatory programmes: Scanned copy of the original secondary school graduation certificate or equivalent AND its translation. For Master's programmes: Scanned copy of the original bachelor’s degree certificate or equivalent AND its translation. For PhD programmes: 17/18 years degree or equivalent.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Proof of language proficiency for the language of instruction is required. Accepted proofs include FCE, CAE, IELTS (5.5+), TOEFL (69+ for general, 95-120 for specific MA English Studies programs), or CEFR B2-level English. If previous studies were in the language of the selected program, proof of that can be submitted instead.

additional_requirements.career_plan: Applicants are advised to reflect on their academic and career goals and explain how the Stipendium Hungaricum scholarship will help them achieve these, typically through a motivation letter.
additional_requirements.age_limits: No upper age limit set by the program, but applicants must be at least 18 years old by 31 August of the commencement year (e.g., 31 August 2025 for the 2025/2026 academic year). Country-specific age requirements may apply, and applicants should consult their Sending Partner.
additional_requirements.gender_requirement: No specific gender requirement; gender information is collected during the application process.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: The Students at Risk Subprogramme is available. Current Stipendium Hungaricum scholarship holders can reapply for a higher academic level. Applicants without a passport can upload a declaration and national ID. For partial (exchange) study programmes, a certificate about student status from the current higher education institution is required.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Some Sending Partners (e.g., Pakistan's HEC) require online applications through their national scholarship portal in addition to the Stipendium Hungaricum portal. Some countries (e.g., Kazakhstan) may require a commitment to return and work for a specified period after studies. Scholarship holders must maintain a minimum CGPA (e.g., 3.0 on a 5.0 scale or 2.5 on a 4.0 scale) and are permitted to work up to 30 hours a week during the teaching period.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Secondary school graduation certificate (for Bachelor's/One-tier Master's/Non-degree Hungarian language prep), Bachelor’s degree certificate (for Master's), 17/18 years degree (for PhD), certificate of student status (for partial/exchange studies), proof of language proficiency, motivation letter. All documents not in English or Hungarian must be accompanied by a translation. Final degree and transcript must be submitted by August 01, 2025 (for HEC applicants).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applicants are informed of results by their country's ministry of education or national scholarship agency. Host institutions conduct formal checks of documents and may require entrance exams/interviews. Sending Partners nominate candidates (e.g., February 2025). Final results are announced (e.g., June 2025).
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Launched in 2013. Managed by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade and coordinated by Tempus Public Foundation. Offers a mentor network (HÖOK) and an Alumni Hungary Network with internship opportunities.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Application period opens mid-November 2024, deadline 15 January 2025. Sending Partners nominate candidates in February 2025. Final results announced in June 2025. Studies commence in September 2025.

basic_info.provider: Chinese Government, China Scholarship Council (CSC), Chinese Ministry of Education, Chinese Embassies/Consulates abroad (e.g., in USA, Ireland, Malaysia, Sweden, Sri Lanka), American Association of State Colleges and Universities (AASCU) for AASCU-designated program.

funding_info.funding_details: Full scholarship or partial scholarship. Full scholarship covers tuition waiver, accommodation, stipend, and comprehensive medical insurance. Funding duration varies by program: up to 7 years (including up to 2 years of Chinese language tuition if needed); 4 academic years for bachelor's (5 for medicine); 2-3 academic years for master's; 3 academic years for doctoral; no more than 1 academic year for HSK winner scholarship.

timeline_info.application_deadline: February 14, 2026 (general online submission); Specific deadlines vary by country/program (e.g., 12th February, 2025 for Israel; 30 September 2025 for DHET; early April general timeframe).
timeline_info.opening_date: Early January (general timeframe); November 12, 2024 (for EU Window 2025/2026); October 25, 2025 (for Sweden 2026/2027); September 15, 2025 (for 2026 guide).
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Over 35,000 scholarships to international students yearly.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to students from 170+ countries, including all nationalities for some programs. Specific programs may target nationals of 'One Belt One Road' initiative countries (Silk Road program), or students enrolled at AASCU member institutions (AASCU-designated program), or University of Minnesota students. Available for short-term or long-term study at 250+ designated Chinese universities.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Diverse fields such as science, engineering, agriculture, medicine, economics, law, philosophy, education, literature (Fine Arts excluded), history, and management. Available for Chinese-taught or English-taught programs.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Awardees may not concurrently hold overlapping Chinese government-funded scholarships.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: Minimum GPA 2.8 (out of 4) or GPA 3.5 (out of 5) or 70 percentile.
academic_requirements.required_degree: High school graduate (at least) for general scholar programs; Bachelor's degree holder or above for master's programs; Master's degree holder or above for doctoral programs; Undergraduate, master's, and PhD studies are sponsored.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Work experience, professional training, or related education/working background.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: HSK Level 3 for Chinese-taught undergraduate or general scholar programs (exempt for Chinese language studies); HSK 4 (180) for Master’s and Ph.D. Chinese-taught programs. Applicants can provide a Chinese language instruction certificate if their previous degree was Chinese-taught. TOEFL and IELTS are mentioned as language requirements (no specific scores provided). CSCA (Chinese Scholarship Council Admission test) may be required (e.g., December 21, 2025, or January 25, 2026 for September 2026 enrollment).

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two letters of recommendation in Chinese or English from professors or associate professors are required for graduate programs or senior scholar programs.
additional_requirements.career_plan: A study plan of at least 1,500 words is required. Doctoral students' proposals must be signed by their Chinese supervisor.
additional_requirements.age_limits: Under 45 for general scholar programs; Under 40 for HSK winner scholarship; Under 35 for master's programs; Under 40 for doctoral programs.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Applicants must not have finished their previous study within China or it has been at least a year since they completed their previous study if it was completed in China.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Photocopy of the Foreigner Physical Examination Form completed in English (for stays over 6 months). All applicants must provide a pre-admission document issued by the universities applying.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: CSC Application Form (downloaded after online application), two letters of recommendation, Foreigner Physical Examination Form, HSK reports (if applicable), pre-admission document, study plan (1,500+ words), doctoral proposal signed by supervisor, Chinese language instruction certificate (if applicable), official documents containing English name, gender, nationality. Online submission required, no hard copies. Documents must be attached in PDF format.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Online application through CSC portal (http://www.campuschina.org) followed by application to selected university's online system. Some countries (e.g., Ireland) have a national assessment and nomination process. Nominated students are notified within three weeks of the application deadline. Admission letters and Visa Application Forms (JW201) are issued by the Chinese Ministry of Education and host Chinese university in June or July.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Chinese Government Scholarship is a comprehensive program for international students to study in China, offered through various channels including Bilateral Programs, EU Window, Silk Road Program, and Chinese University Programs. It supports study at over 250-280+ designated Chinese universities. Application instructions (e.g., 2025-2026) and information systems (CGSIS) are available.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarship applications are typically for academic years (e.g., 2025/2026, 2026/2027) with enrollment often in September.

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship program offering comprehensive financial support.
covered_expenses: Monthly stipends (equivalent to three Colombian legal monthly minimum wages)
One-time grant for the issuance of a foreign identification card

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Foreign Citizens from all Nationalities. Applicants must not have dual Colombian nationality. Must not be residing in Colombia, nor have resided in Colombian territory for the last 6 months prior to applying, or have started studies in Colombia at the time of application. Must not have been a previous beneficiary of the ICETEX Beca Colombia program. Candidates must hold a professional or bachelor’s degree and be between 25-49 years old. The scholarship targets high-achieving international students with exceptional academic merit and leadership.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master’s, Ph.D., and Specialization Degree programs across a variety of degrees and academic disciplines.
field_restrictions.restrictions: If the candidate is selected, the change of academic program or university is not allowed.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: At least 4.0 on the Colombian scale of 1 to 5 (for undergraduate degree)
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate degree (university degree or bachelor) to apply; pursuing Master’s, Ph.D., or Specialization Degree.

experience_requirements.accepted_types: Professional experience in their field of study

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: TOEFL iBT, TOEFL ITP, and Academic IELTS are required for postgraduate scholarship calls. Applicants with an IELTS score 0.5 below the entry requirement and a strong academic record may be considered for bridging English Language Training. The scholarship allows time and resources for students to strengthen their Spanish language skills prior to beginning their academic program.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Recent academic letter of reference from a university professor (dated 2019 or later).
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Open to applicants from non-Spanish-speaking countries.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Meeting academic, language, and documentation requirements is crucial. No application fee is required.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Verified copies of Educational Transcripts, University certificate-transcript (English/Spanish) certifying average grade point, recent academic letter of reference.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Colombia Government Scholarship, also known as Beca Colombia, is a prestigious fully funded program for international students administered by ICETEX. It aims to promote higher education, international cooperation, and strengthen social ties by offering comprehensive support for postgraduate studies (Master's, PhD, Specialization) at Colombian public and private institutions.

basic_info.official_name: Government of Ireland International Education Scholarship (GOI-IES)
basic_info.provider: Government of Ireland, in partnership with Irish higher education institutions (HEIs), managed by the Higher Education Authority (HEA)

funding_info.funding_details: 60 scholarships awarded annually for one year of full-time study. Each scholarship includes a €10,000 stipend and a full tuition fee waiver from the host institution. Applicants must ensure they have sufficient additional funding or personal savings to cover other costs while studying in Ireland.

timeline_info.opening_date: Applications open for the 2025/2026 academic year (2025 call open)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to outstanding non-EU/EEA students (domiciliary of origin outside the EU/EEA/Switzerland/United Kingdom). Must have a conditional or final offer of admission to an eligible Irish higher education institution for a full-time master’s, postgraduate diploma, or PhD programme. Applicants who have previously received a GOI-IES scholarship are not eligible.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master’s, Postgraduate Diploma, or PhD programmes (NFQ levels 9 or 10)

academic_requirements.min_gpa: 3.0 or higher on a 4.0 scale in their undergraduate degree
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate degree (to pursue Master's, Postgraduate Diploma, or PhD)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Required if mandated by the host institution; the scholarship itself does not mandate it.

additional_requirements.other_requirements: Must be an international, fee-paying student. Must possess a valid offer letter from an eligible Irish institution at the time of applying for the scholarship.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Academic transcripts, recommendation letters, personal statement/Statement of Purpose, essay questions, passport, offer letter, marksheet. Additional documents include GOI-IES Call Document, FAQs, Selection Process Infographic, Guidance for Referees, and Application Help Document.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Primary assessment criteria include prior experience, personal statement, and references. Applications are sent for independent remote evaluation to Assessment Panel members.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: A prestigious initiative and flagship funding offer aimed at attracting top-level international students to study in Ireland.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarships are for one year of full-time study during the 2025/2026 academic year.

basic_info.provider: Flemish Ministry of Education and Training (Government of Flanders)

funding_info.funding_details: A grant of €10,000 - €10,020 and a tuition fee waiver per academic year. Described as a fully-funded scholarship covering tuition fees and providing a generous grant for living expenses.

timeline_info.application_deadline: Initial application to host university (including Candidacy Form): 15 January (e.g., 15 January 2025 for 2025-2026 academic year, 15 January 2026 for 2026-2027 academic year). Master Mind application form (after nomination): 15 March 2025 (for 2025-2026 academic year).

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Outstanding students from all over the world. Must apply to and be accepted by a Flemish higher education institution for a Master's degree program. Previous degree cannot have been obtained at a Flemish higher education institution (except for credit mobility programs like Erasmus+). Students already enrolled in a Flemish higher education institution are not eligible. Must not hold Belgian nationality. Must be under the age of 35.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Master's programmes in Flanders and Brussels, including Humanities and Social Sciences, Science, Engineering and Technology, and Biomedical Sciences.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Preparatory programmes and distance learning are not eligible. Specific other programs may also be excluded (not listed).

academic_requirements.required_degree: Bachelor's degree (to be eligible for Master's programs)

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Online language tests of IELTS (IELTS Indicator) and TOEFL (TOEFL iBT Special Home Edition) are accepted.

additional_requirements.career_plan: Motivation letter (expected to explain how education applies to career)
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: International students who have been on credit mobility in a hosting Flemish higher education institution are still eligible.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Complete application file for an eligible Master’s programme, KU Leuven Scholarships & Master Mind Candidacy Form, Master Mind application form, Curriculum Vitae, Official transcripts (translated into English, Dutch), Motivation letter, two recommendation letters.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Host institutions (e.g., KU Leuven) nominate eligible students who expressed interest. The host institution creates the candidate’s application file in the Mobility-Online tool and performs an academic check. Pre-selected candidates receive an email generated by Mobility-Online.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Master Mind Scholarship, awarded by the Flemish Ministry of Education and Training, provides scholarships to outstanding international students for Master's programmes in Flanders and Brussels.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Step 1: Submit a complete application file for an eligible Master’s programme (including Candidacy Form) to the host university by January 15. Host institution nominates eligible students. Step 2: Complete the Master Mind application form and upload required documents by March 15 (for the 2025-2026 academic year).

funding_info.funding_details: The scholarship provides financial assistance to cover tuition, materials, accommodation, and other study-related expenses. It is described as 'fully funded' by some sources. Specific benefits mentioned include: up to CNY 2000/month (general), CNY 1700/month for Master students, CNY 10,000/year for Master’s degree, CNY 10,000/year for Doctoral degree, comprehensive insurance coverage worth CNY 800/year, and a one-time allowance of CNY 800 for new students. The scholarship supports students for one academic year, with specific funding levels depending on the prize type (first prize or second prize).

timeline_info.application_deadline: May 31, 2025 (for Tianjin University); June 30, 2025 (for Tianjin Normal University)

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Applicants must be international students (non-Chinese citizens) with good physical and mental health. The scholarship is open to both prospective students and current students. Applicants must be self-funded international students applying for undergraduate, master's or doctoral programs at eligible universities in Tianjin, or foreign self-funded undergraduate, postgraduate, PhD students who have normally enrolled in Tianjin.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: The scholarship is applicable to various academic programs. Chemical Engineering (at Tianjin University) is specifically mentioned as offering quality master programs with scholarships. Applicants could apply to Higher Education Institutions that are eligible to enroll.

academic_requirements.min_gpa: High School applicants: Minimum average of 80% or above. College/University applicants: Minimum GPA of 3.0 or above. (Note: A GPA of at least 3.2/4.0 is mentioned specifically for the MBA program).
academic_requirements.required_degree: Undergraduate, Master's, or Ph.D. programs (Bachelor, Master, Doctoral degrees)

experience_requirements.min_years: At least one year of work experience is required for the MBA program.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: For Chinese-instructed programs: HSK-5 certificates with a minimum score of 180. For English-instructed programs: English Proficiency Certificates (e.g., IELTS 6.5 or TOEFL 85 for MBA program). Other Chinese learning and examination certificates are also accepted. Chinese or English Proficiency Certificate is generally required.

additional_requirements.reference_letters: Two recommendation letters are required for master or doctoral degree studies and senior scholar programs.
additional_requirements.career_plan: Personal Statement, including study or research plan, personal background, financial situation, personal strengths etc., written in Chinese or English (no less than 800 words for Master and Doctor Degree, no less than 300 words for Bachelor’ degree application).
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: The scholarship is a one-year duration scholarship and can be applied for year by year/annually. Applicants must be self-funded international students.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Applicants must meet the language requirements of the higher education institutions and provide relevant proofs. All documents must be in English or Chinese. Use clear and concise language in personal statement.

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Tianjin Government Scholarship Application Form (signed by applicant), online application system registration, Personal Statement (including study/research plan, personal background, financial situation, strengths, in Chinese or English, min 800 words for Master/Doctor, min 300 words for Bachelor), Admission Letter, Application Form for Visa to China for Overseas Students (JW202 or JW201), Physical Examination Report and Test Report (Original Copy), Passports with a validity period of six months or more, Original No Crime Certificate, Chinese or English Proficiency Certificate, Study Experience Resume, two recommendation letters (for Master/Doctor/Senior Scholar), Foreigner Physical Examination Form, copy of applicant’s residence permit (if applicable). All documents must be in English or Chinese.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Applicants must pass the international student review at the university and be pre-admitted to be eligible for nomination. The assessment results are publicized for one week, then submitted to Tianjin Municipal Education Commission. The Scholarship List is determined by experts organized by Tianjin Municipal Education Commission. Tianjin University announces admission results on its website and sends Admission Notice and Visa Application Form (JW202) to scholarship winners from July 1 to August 31.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: The Tianjin Government Scholarship provides an outstanding opportunity for international students to receive an internationally respected education and to be immersed in the vibrant atmosphere of Tianjin, one of China’s biggest and most rapidly growing cities. It is designed to attract talented students from around the world to study in China and immerse themselves in its rich culture and academic excellence. It is a one-year scholarship, renewable annually, open to both prospective and current students.

basic_info.provider: Italian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation (MAECI)

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarship, offering full or partial tuition waivers, monthly stipends (€900 per month), and health/medical/accident insurance. The grant is incompatible with any other Italian government or public institution grant (e.g., DSU scholarships). Tuition and enrollment fees are required for advanced Italian language and culture courses.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: Open to foreign citizens not residing in Italy and Italian citizens living abroad (IRE). Applicants must hold an appropriate academic qualification required for enrollment. Selection is based on academic merit, motivation, and language proficiency (Italian or English). Applicants must meet specific age and language criteria. The scholarship is incompatible with other Italian government scholarships.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Bachelor’s degrees, Master’s degrees, Higher Education in Arts, Music, and Dance (AFAM) programs, PhD programs, research under academic supervision, Specialization and Vocational Schools, and Italian language or cultural courses.
field_restrictions.restrictions: Cannot be combined with other Italian government scholarships or grants (e.g., DSU scholarships). Tuition and enrollment fees are required for advanced Italian language and culture courses.

academic_requirements.required_degree: Appropriate academic qualification required for enrollment (e.g., secondary education for Bachelor's, Bachelor's for Master's, Master's for PhD).

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: Knowledge of Italian or English language, depending on the program. Italian A2 (CEFR) for language/culture courses. Italian B2 (CEFR) for Italian-taught programs. English proficiency required for English-taught programs (B2 level mentioned for Master's/AFAM).

additional_requirements.age_limits: Bachelor’s Degree: ≤ 23 years old by the deadline. Master’s Degree/AFAM/Italian Language and Culture advanced courses: ≤ 28 years old by the deadline. PhD programs: ≤ 30 years old by the deadline. Exceptions apply for renewals.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Admission letter from the Italian university/institute is required for PhD programs. Applicants must not be residing in Italy (unless Italian citizens living abroad).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Score statement, admission letter from the university in Italy (especially for PhD), a personal statement (maximum 1000 words), and a certificate of Italian language proficiency (if applicable).
background_and_logistics.selection_process: Based on academic merit, motivation, and language knowledge. A selection committee is appointed by the Italian Embassy in each country, making selections based on academic performance and other personal criteria.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Offered by the Italian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation (MAECI) for the 2025-2026 academic year. Aims to foster international cultural, scientific, and technological cooperation, promote Italian language and culture, and support Italy’s economic system. Scholarship duration ranges from 3 to 9 months (3 months for language courses, 6-9 months for degree programs), renewable for multi-year courses.

basic_info.provider: Thailand Government, Thailand International Cooperation Agency (TICA), Thai Universities/Academic Institutions

funding_info.funding_details: Fully funded scholarships for international students to pursue postgraduate studies.

timeline_info.application_deadline: January 31, 2025 (for submission to Royal Thai Embassy/Permanent Mission/Consulate General)
timeline_info.number_of_awards: Over 70 postgraduate scholarships; up to five (5) candidates per course/academic year per eligible country/territory.

eligibility_criteria.eligibility_details: International students from developing countries. Candidates must be nominated by the National Focal Point for International Development Cooperation (e.g., Ministry of Foreign Affairs) or relevant central government agencies for which they currently work. Be working in the government sector or in areas related to the course provided. Have a Bachelor’s degree and/or professional experience in a related field or related to the graduate degree. Have a good command of English. Be no more than 45 years of age. Have good physical and mental condition and must not be pregnant. Civil servants must fulfill BCSR 2023 criteria and scholarship guidelines. Applicants outside civil service (Corporate, Private Sector, NGO, etc.) must fulfill Department of Workforce Planning and Skills Development, MoESD criteria and scholarship guidelines. Allocated for specific OIC member states.

field_restrictions.eligible_fields: Development topics under six themes: Sufficiency Economy Philosophy (SEP), Public Health, Agriculture and Food Security, Climate Change and Environmental Issues, Bio-Circular-Green Economy (BCG) Model, and other topics related to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).
field_restrictions.restrictions: Applicants must be from eligible countries/territories (developing countries, specific OIC member states).

academic_requirements.required_degree: Master's Degree (to be pursued); Bachelor's Degree (as prerequisite)

experience_requirements.min_years: Minimum three years of work experience with the nominating agency at the time of application.
experience_requirements.accepted_types: Professional experience related to the field of study or graduate degree; working in the government sector or related areas.

test_requirements.ielts_toefl_other_language_certificates: English score (e.g., TOEFL/IELTS) or good command of English.

additional_requirements.age_limits: No more than 45 years of age.
additional_requirements.special_circumstances: Must not be pregnant; good physical and mental condition.
additional_requirements.other_requirements: Obtain own travel insurance; cover all costs arising from visa application (visa fee, travel to embassy/consulate, postal fee, transit visa fee).

background_and_logistics.application_documents: Application form (two completed copies, hard copy required), Recommendation letters, English score (e.g., TOEFL/IELTS), Thesis proposal or other documents (as university request), List of TIPP courses, Guidelines, List of eligible countries/territories.
background_and_logistics.selection_process: National Focal Point nominates candidates and forwards documents to Royal Thai Embassy/Permanent Mission/Consulate General, which then sends them to TICA. Application is complete when TICA receives hard copies through the Royal Thai Embassy/Mission/Consulate General.
background_and_logistics.scholarship_info: Launched in 2000 as a framework for providing postgraduate scholarships for people in other developing countries. Aims to share Thailand’s best practices and experience, build global partnerships, empower students with advanced skills and knowledge, and allow participants to experience Thailand’s rich culture and warm hospitality.
background_and_logistics.timeline_summary: Scholarships primarily for 2025, with some mentions of 2026-2027 for future cycles.
